messages.subject: Artist ToddlersRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4554
messages.msgSnippet: We always said No1  Draw on paper!  But we are not very politically correct around here .  At the same time we took a 20,000 dollar loss on our house when
messages.messageBody:
We always said "No1 Draw on paper!" But we are not very politically
correct around here <G>. At the same time we took a 20,000 dollar loss
on our house when we sold it because of all the art <G>

Pax,
Crys

Domus Ludus
Non scholae sed vitae discimus
Certified in Child Psychology and Human Development
http://www.geocities.com/cas_the_author/DomusLudus/
DomusLudus@...

On 22 Mar 2004 20:27:13 -0000 UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
writes:

>
>Message: 22
> Date: Mon, 22 Mar 2004 15:10:45 -0500
> From: "Brian and Kathy Stamp" <bstamp@...>
>Subject: The little problems with toddlers
>
>So what do you do when your toddler is coloring on the furniture or
>somethi=
>ng along those lines? Innocent stuff, that they are doing just because
>they=
> don't know that it's not polite to color on your furniture.=20
>
>Obviously we offer paper and such. I'm just wondering how you handle
>things=
> when you turn your back for a second to go to the bathroom. Is it
>really j=
>ust about being there 100% of the time? Would you say "NO" or just say
>"we =
>color on paper" matter of factly?
>
>Trying to do it differently with my last little girl here. My others
>would =
>have just been told "NO!!"=20
>
>
>Kathy
>
>
